definition: to show one's true nature (derog.)/to betray oneself

sentences.english: Compared with conscious education, subconscious education has its own characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 隐形教育与显形教育相比，有其自身明显的特征。

sentences.english: Fixed a problem that prevented Watcher Wards from being revealed by the Dust of Appearance.
sentences.chinese: 修正了哨岗守卫不被显形之尘显现的问题。

sentences.english: And the day's veil fell from the world of sleep.
sentences.chinese: 黎明的面纱便从沉睡的世界中缓缓显形。

sentences.english: Description: A revealing charm that will show anything hidden by magic.
sentences.chinese: 一个显示咒，使得任何被魔法所隐藏的物件显形。

sentences.english: The recognition of the importance of both explicit and tacit knowledge to an organization.
sentences.chinese: 认识到显形知识和隐形知识对一个机构的重要性。

sentences.english: If the information was out there, it was already in the price.
sentences.chinese: 若信息显形，那它已包含在价格内。

definition: to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
the real body (of Buddha or a God)/true effigy
human shape/in human form/of human appearance/doll/puppet
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
to vanish/to hide/to cover one's traces
